If you do n't want to miss out on an opportunity to make your content great , always ask yourself these questions : 1 ) Is it really readable ? If you do not want to miss out on an opportunity to make your content great , is it really readable ?
It 's easy to bog content down in ways that make it hard for readers to understand . It is easy to bog down in ways that make it hard for readers to understand .

2 ) Is it easily scanable ? Do you think it was too easy ?

Even though we want people to read our content , the reality is that people are short on time and often skim instead . Even though we want people to read our content , the reality is that people are short on time and often skim .

That 's why you should always ensure that your content is laid out to accommodate people who are scanning so that they can get the gist of what you 're trying to communicate even if they do n't read every word . Improving scanability often is as simple as : Breaking up long paragraphs into smaller , easier-to-consume chunks Breaking up paragraphs with headings and sub-heads Putting key information into bulleted lists . I can often sub-heads Breaking up long , easier-to-consume and Putting .

3 ) Was it written with a specific audience in mind ? Was it written with a specific audience ?
As writers , we always want our content to resonate with our audiences . As writers , we always want our content to resonate with our audiences .

Yet unless we have a good understanding of who our audience is — and in particular what they need and care about — that 's pretty hard to do . Unless we have a good understanding of who our audience is , and care about what they need and care about .

This is one of the main tenets of content marketing . This is one of the main issues in the world .

The whole point of creating content is to get your audience to do something as a result of consuming it . The whole point of creating content is to get your audience to do something as a result .

There are lots of great ideas out there and not all of them are going to be yours . There are many great ideas out there , and not all of them are going to be yours .

Here 's a quick grammar quiz for you . There is a quick grammar quiz for you .
Which of the two sentences below is correct ? The two sentences are correct .
Julia took Edward and I to the movies . Both Julia took Edward and I to the movies .

While you might hear either of those sentences in conversation , only one of them is actually right . While you may hear either of those sentences in conversation , it is only one of them is right .
Do you know which ? Do you know which ?
It 's the second sentence . It is the second sentence .
Not sure why ? I am not sure why .
Let 's take a closer look at these two , sometimes confusing , personal pronouns . Let 's take a closer look at these two , sometimes confusing .
It 's All About Me ( or I ? ) It is all About Me ( or I ) .

Personal pronouns like I , me , his , she , their , and them do n't usually give writers much trouble : I had a cup of coffee before leaving for work . Personal pronouns like I me , he , their , and them do not give writers much trouble . I had a cup of coffee before leaving for work .
( I is the subject of the sentence . ) I am the subject of the sentence .
They left me a note before leaving on vacation . They left me a note before leaving on vacation .
( Me is the object of the verb left . ) I am the object of the verb left .

Where things can start to get tricky , however , is when you have a sentence with two subjects or two objects joined by the word `` and . '' Where things start to get tricky , however , is when you have a sentence with two objects or two objects joined by the word `` and '' .
For example : The stray cat followed Alex and I / Alex and me all the way down the street . For example : The stray followed Alex , and I am all the way down the street .
Anna and I / Anna and me decided to go for a walk . I / Anna & Me decided to go for a walk .
The good news is that there 's a simple trick for figuring out which pronoun to use . The good news is that there is a trick for figuring out which pronoun to use .
All you have to do is remove the other person from the sentence . All you have to do is remove the other person from the sentence .

When you do , it immediately becomes obvious which pronoun is correct : The stray cat followed me all the way down the street . When you do , it becomes obvious to the cat followed by the street followed by the street .
I decided to go for a walk . I decided to go for a walk .

The same then holds true when you add the other person back in : The stray cat followed Alex and me all the way down the street . The same then holds true when you add the other person back in the street .
Anna and I decided to go for a walk . I decided to go for a walk .

So when in doubt , simplify the sentence in question and you 'll find it much easier to figure out which pronoun is actually correct . When in doubt , it is the sentence in question and you will find it much easier .
